m_values.name: statement
m_values.description: The data to print

m_values.name: hitboxName
m_values.description: The name of the hitbox to create. If the hitbox already exists for this Action, it will be overwritten with an empty one, so be careful! Each Hitbox should have a unique name.

m_values.name: lockGroup
m_values.description: Hitboxes do not count as a collision if another hitbox in the same Lock Group has already hit the opponent. Use these locks to define sweetspots and sourspots to avoid having multiple hitboxes all hit on the same frame. Leave blank if this hitbox doesn't group up with any others and will always connect if it hits.

m_values.name: centerX
m_values.description: The X-coordinate of the center of the Hitbox. This is relative to the center of the fighter, so a Hitbox with 0 here will be horizontally centerred on the fighter. Negative values are opposite the character's facing direction

m_values.name: centerY
m_values.description: The Y-coordinate of the center of the Hitbox. This is relative to the center of the fighter, so a Hitbox with 0 here will be vertically centerred on the fighter. Negative values are upward.

m_values.name: width
m_values.description: The end-to-end distance of the Hitbox horizontally.

m_values.name: height
m_values.description: The end-to-end distance of the Hitbox vertically.

m_values.name: damage
m_values.description: The damage in percent that the hitbox does to an opponent

m_values.name: angle
m_values.description: The angle the move launches the target at. This is in degrees, with 0 being straight forward, 90 being straight up, and 180 being backwards. Negative values and values over 360 will be projected into the 360 degree space, so -90 will become 270, and 361 will become 1 (for "Sakurai Angle" hitboxes, see the "Sakurai Threshold" in the advanced section)

m_values.name: baseKnockback
m_values.description: The base amount of knockback the move has, before applying other modifiers like percentage, weight, etc.

m_values.name: knockbackGrowth
m_values.description: The rate at which the knockback strength increases based on the opponent's percentage.

m_values.name: chargeDamage
m_values.description: The amount of damage to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: chargeBaseKnockback
m_values.description: The amount of baseKnockback to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: chargeKnockbackGrowth
m_values.description: The amount of knockbackGrowth to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: shieldDamage
m_values.description: The amount of "extra" damage done to the shield of the opponent if blocked. Can also be negative to make a Hitbox less effective on shields than fighters.

m_values.name: hitstunScaling
m_values.description: A multiplier applied to the final knockback value for the purposes of calculating hitstun. A value of 1.0 will have a normal amount of hitstun for its knockback, while a value of 2.0 will keep the opponent in hitstun for twice as long. If hitstunScaling is 0 or less, the move will have no hitstun, dealing damage without knocking the fighter back or interrupting their action.

m_values.name: shieldstunScaling
m_values.description: A multiplier applied to the final knockback value for the purposes of determining how long the defending player should be in shield stun, unable to lower their shield. 1.0 for normal shieldstun, while 2.0 would double the amount of shieldstun.

m_values.name: sakuraiThreshold
m_values.description: The amount of knockback a move has to deal before the opponent will be lifted off the ground. If the total knockback value is lower than this, the opponent will be put in hitstun and slid along the ground, ignoring the given angle of the Hitbox.

m_values.name: hitboxName
m_values.description: The Name of the Hitbox to activate

m_values.name: life
m_values.description: The number of frames to keep the hitbox active for. If set to -1, the Hitbox will remain open forever until explicitly deactivated.

A value of 1.0 will have a normal amount of hitstun for its knockback, while a value of 2.0 will keep the opponent in hitstun for twice as long. If hitstunScaling is 0 or less, the move will have no hitstun, dealing damage without knocking the fighter back or interrupting their action.

m_values.name: shieldstunScaling
m_values.description: A multiplier applied to the final knockback value for the purposes of determining how long the defending player should be in shield stun, unable to lower their shield. 1.0 for normal shieldstun, while 2.0 would double the amount of shieldstun.

m_values.name: sakuraiThreshold
m_values.description: The amount of knockback a move has to deal before the opponent will be lifted off the ground. If the total knockback value is lower than this, the opponent will be put in hitstun and slid along the ground, ignoring the given angle of the Hitbox.

m_values.name: hitboxName
m_values.description: The name of the hitbox to create. If the hitbox already exists for this Action, it will be overwritten with an empty one, so be careful! Each Hitbox should have a unique name.

m_values.name: lockGroup
m_values.description: Hitboxes do not count as a collision if another hitbox in the same Lock Group has already hit the opponent. Use these locks to define sweetspots and sourspots to avoid having multiple hitboxes all hit on the same frame. Leave blank if this hitbox doesn't group up with any others and will always connect if it hits.

m_values.name: centerX
m_values.description: The X-coordinate of the center of the Hitbox. This is relative to the center of the fighter, so a Hitbox with 0 here will be horizontally centerred on the fighter. Negative values are opposite the character's facing direction

m_values.name: centerY
m_values.description: The Y-coordinate of the center of the Hitbox. This is relative to the center of the fighter, so a Hitbox with 0 here will be vertically centerred on the fighter. Negative values are upward.

m_values.name: width
m_values.description: The end-to-end distance of the Hitbox horizontally.

m_values.name: height
m_values.description: The end-to-end distance of the Hitbox vertically.

m_values.name: damage
m_values.description: The damage in percent that the hitbox does to an opponent

m_values.name: angle
m_values.description: The angle the move launches the target at. This is in degrees, with 0 being straight forward, 90 being straight up, and 180 being backwards. Negative values and values over 360 will be projected into the 360 degree space, so -90 will become 270, and 361 will become 1 (for "Sakurai Angle" hitboxes, see the "Sakurai Threshold" in the advanced section)

m_values.name: baseKnockback
m_values.description: The base amount of knockback the move has, before applying other modifiers like percentage, weight, etc.

m_values.name: knockbackGrowth
m_values.description: The rate at which the knockback strength increases based on the opponent's percentage.

m_values.name: chargeDamage
m_values.description: The amount of damage to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: chargeBaseKnockback
m_values.description: The amount of baseKnockback to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: chargeKnockbackGrowth
m_values.description: The amount of knockbackGrowth to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: shieldDamage
m_values.description: The amount of "extra" damage done to the shield of the opponent if blocked. Can also be negative to make a Hitbox less effective on shields than fighters.

m_values.name: hitstunScaling
m_values.description: A multiplier applied to the final knockback value for the purposes of calculating hitstun. A value of 1.0 will have a normal amount of hitstun for its knockback, while a value of 2.0 will keep the opponent in hitstun for twice as long. If hitstunScaling is 0 or less, the move will have no hitstun, dealing damage without knocking the fighter back or interrupting their action.

m_values.name: shieldstunScaling
m_values.description: A multiplier applied to the final knockback value for the purposes of determining how long the defending player should be in shield stun, unable to lower their shield. 1.0 for normal shieldstun, while 2.0 would double the amount of shieldstun.

m_values.description: The amount of knockback a move has to deal before the opponent will be lifted off the ground. If the total knockback value is lower than this, the opponent will be put in hitstun and slid along the ground, ignoring the given angle of the Hitbox.

m_values.name: variable
m_values.description: The variable to set. Follows the same logic as if you were trying to retrieve this variable for another argument, so if you set the source to "Owner", and the type to "String", it will set the string variable with the given name in the owner object. A better description can be found in the documentation.

m_values.name: value
m_values.description: The value to set the variable to. This one will be fully parsed and resolved, and used to set (or modify) the variable given in the source parameter.

m_values.name: hitboxName
m_values.description: The Name of the Hitbox to activate

m_values.name: life
m_values.description: The number of frames to keep the hitbox active for. If set to -1, the Hitbox will remain open forever until explicitly deactivated.

m_values.description: The amount of knockback a move has to deal before the opponent will be lifted off the ground. If the total knockback value is lower than this, the opponent will be put in hitstun and slid along the ground, ignoring the given angle of the Hitbox.

m_values.name: hitboxName
m_values.description: The name of the hitbox to create. If the hitbox already exists for this Action, it will be overwritten with an empty one, so be careful! Each Hitbox should have a unique name.

m_values.name: lockGroup
m_values.description: Hitboxes do not count as a collision if another hitbox in the same Lock Group has already hit the opponent. Use these locks to define sweetspots and sourspots to avoid having multiple hitboxes all hit on the same frame. Leave blank if this hitbox doesn't group up with any others and will always connect if it hits.

m_values.name: centerX
m_values.description: The X-coordinate of the center of the Hitbox. This is relative to the center of the fighter, so a Hitbox with 0 here will be horizontally centerred on the fighter. Negative values are opposite the character's facing direction

m_values.name: centerY
m_values.description: The Y-coordinate of the center of the Hitbox. This is relative to the center of the fighter, so a Hitbox with 0 here will be vertically centerred on the fighter. Negative values are upward.

m_values.name: width
m_values.description: The end-to-end distance of the Hitbox horizontally.

m_values.name: height
m_values.description: The end-to-end distance of the Hitbox vertically.

m_values.name: damage
m_values.description: The damage in percent that the hitbox does to an opponent

m_values.name: angle
m_values.description: The angle the move launches the target at. This is in degrees, with 0 being straight forward, 90 being straight up, and 180 being backwards. Negative values and values over 360 will be projected into the 360 degree space, so -90 will become 270, and 361 will become 1 (for "Sakurai Angle" hitboxes, see the "Sakurai Threshold" in the advanced section)

m_values.name: baseKnockback
m_values.description: The base amount of knockback the move has, before applying other modifiers like percentage, weight, etc.

m_values.name: knockbackGrowth
m_values.description: The rate at which the knockback strength increases based on the opponent's percentage.

m_values.name: chargeDamage
m_values.description: The amount of damage to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: chargeBaseKnockback
m_values.description: The amount of baseKnockback to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: chargeKnockbackGrowth
m_values.description: The amount of knockbackGrowth to add to the Hitbox every time the "Charge" subaction is called on it

m_values.name: shieldDamage
m_values.description: The amount of "extra" damage done to the shield of the opponent if blocked. Can also be negative to make a Hitbox less effective on shields than fighters.

m_values.name: hitstunScaling
m_values.description: A multiplier applied to the final knockback value for the purposes of calculating hitstun. A value of 1.0 will have a normal amount of hitstun for its knockback, while a value of 2.0 will keep the opponent in hitstun for twice as long. If hitstunScaling is 0 or less, the move will have no hitstun, dealing damage without knocking the fighter back or interrupting their action.

m_values.name: shieldstunScaling
m_values.description: A multiplier applied to the final knockback value for the purposes of determining how long the defending player should be in shield stun, unable to lower their shield. 1.0 for normal shieldstun, while 2.0 would double the amount of shieldstun.

m_values.name: sakuraiThreshold
m_values.description: The amount of knockback a move has to deal before the opponent will be lifted off the ground. If the total knockback value is lower than this, the opponent will be put in hitstun and slid along the ground, ignoring the given angle of the Hitbox.

m_values.name: hitboxName
m_values.description: The Name of the Hitbox to activate

m_values.name: life
m_values.description: The number of frames to keep the hitbox active for. If set to -1, the Hitbox will remain open forever until explicitly deactivated.
